content:
This is probably likely to grow conflicts quite quickly; could we get it in (or reject it) soon?

The motivation: docs#list.pairwise, docs#multiset.pairwise, docs#pairwise (Type.pairwise, really), docs#set.pairwise_on. One of these is not like the others.
It already conflicts with one of Yael's PRs, but that PR isn't passing CI yet, and I'm happy to take ownership of resolving the resulting conflicts.
FYI, my PR is about to pass CI. I'm fixing the final files now.
Not exactly in a significant way, but agreed they can't be in the same batch
If you agree, I can break CI by changing set.pairwise and you can queue at the same time as yours.
I do feel like one mind behind one sequence of PR would have avoided those complications.
Not having bors insert a 12hr delay of no successful merging would probably have avoided the race condition
If you put them on the queue at the same time, you risk bors putting them in the wrong order and ending up with nonsense history!
